docs.title: claude-code-autoyes
docs.text: Simple to toggle autoyes across Claude Code sessions

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 🔧 Modern Python tooling with UV package manager
  • 🧪 Comprehensive testing with pytest
  • 🎨 Code formatting with Ruff
  • 🔍 Type checking with MyPy
  • 📚 Documentation with MkDocs + Material
  • 🚀 CI/CD with GitHub Actions
  • 🐳 Docker support for development

docs.title: Local Development Guide
docs.text: Quick reference for testing PRs and developing claude-code-autoyes locally.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# Show all available commands
make help

# Test a specific PR
make dev-test-pr PR=4

# Test daemon functionality  
make dev-daemon-test

# Watch daemon logs
make dev-logs

# Clean up when done
make dev-uninstall

docs.title: 🔧 Development & Testing Commands
docs.text: Command Purpose make dev-install Install current branch as test tool make dev-uninstall Remove test tool installation make dev-test-pr PR=4 Test a specific PR make dev-run Run current code without installing make dev-status Show current development status make dev-daemon-test Test daemon with simulated prompts make dev-logs Tail daemon logs make dev-daemon-stop Stop daemon and clean up

docs.title: 1. Test a Pull Request
docs.text:
# Fetch and test PR #4
make dev-test-pr PR=4

# Now you have 'claude-code-autoyes-test' command available
claude-code-autoyes-test --help
claude-code-autoyes-test status

docs.title: 2. Test Daemon Functionality
docs.text:
# Set up test environment and start daemon
make dev-daemon-test

# In another terminal, watch logs
make dev-logs

# Manually test by attaching to tmux session
tmux attach -t claude-test
./scripts/simulate-claude-prompt.sh

docs.title: 3. Clean Up
docs.text:
# Stop everything and clean up
make dev-daemon-stop
make dev-uninstall

# Return to main branch
git checkout main

docs.title: Tool Installation Details
docs.text: The development commands use UV tool installation with a unique name: - Tool name: claude-code-autoyes-test - Installation: uv tool install --from . --name claude-code-autoyes-test claude-code-autoyes - Isolation: Won't conflict with your main installation

docs.title: Daemon Testing
docs.text:
The daemon testing workflow:

  1. Creates test tmux session: claude-test
  2. Installs test tool: claude-code-autoyes-test
  3. Enables all sessions: Configures daemon to monitor all tmux sessions
  4. Starts daemon: Runs in background monitoring for prompts
  5. Provides test script: scripts/simulate-claude-prompt.sh
  6. Shows logs: Tail /tmp/claude-autoyes.log

docs.title: Manual Testing
docs.text:
For manual testing without make commands:

# Install test version
uv tool install --from . --name my-test-tool claude-code-autoyes

# Test commands
my-test-tool status
my-test-tool daemon start
my-test-tool daemon status

# Clean up
uv tool uninstall my-test-tool

docs.title: Tool Installation Issues
docs.text:
# If installation fails, try forcing reinstall
uv tool install --from . --force-reinstall --name claude-code-autoyes-test claude-code-autoyes

docs.title: Daemon Issues
docs.text:
# Check if daemon is running
claude-code-autoyes-test daemon status

# Check logs
cat /tmp/claude-autoyes.log

# Kill any stuck processes
pkill -f claude-autoyes

docs.title: Tmux Issues
docs.text:
# List tmux sessions
tmux list-sessions

# Kill specific session
tmux kill-session -t claude-test

# Kill all tmux sessions (careful!)
tmux kill-server

  • make mypy - Run type checking
  • make check - Run all quality checks
  • make docs-serve - Serve documentation locally
  • make docs-build - Build documentation
